title: US military’s secret ‘space plane’ has landed after 780 days in orbit
text:
The X-37B on the ground in Florida after 780 days in orbit (US Air Force)

A secret military plane belonging to the United States has landed back on Earth after a full 780 days in orbit.

The unmanned X-37B ‘space plane’ has been circling the globe as part of the top secret Orbital Test Vehicle 5 (OTV-5) mission.

The purpose of the OTV-5 mission remains a bit of a mystery to all but the top brass at the US military.

‘This program continues to push the envelope as the world’s only reusable space vehicle. With a successful landing today, the X-37B completed its longest flight to date and successfully completed all mission objectives,’ said Randy Walden, Air Force Rapid Capabilities Office director, in a statement.

‘This mission successfully hosted Air Force Research Laboratory experiments, among others, as well as providing a ride for small satellites.’

Personnel in self-contained atmospheric protective ensemble suits conduct initial checks on X-37B back in 2010 (Getty)

In the same statement, the US Air Force explained that the X-37B enables the US to ‘efficiently and effectively develop space capabilities necessary to maintain superiority in the space domain.’

The previous record for an orbital mission was 718 days – set by the same vehicle on the OTV-4 mission in May 2017.

The aircraft has a wingspan of less than 15ft – and is taken into space on a rocket, but glides back to Earth like a space shuttle.

During the aircraft’s previous missions, amateur astronomers were able to detect the orbital pattern of the first X-37B which included flyovers of North Korea, Iraq, Iran, Pakistan and Afghanistan, heightening the suspicion that the vehicle was being used for surveillance.
description: The X-37B has landed after 780 days in orbit
